Issue #31 Renault 18 Break Turbo 1983 C. Marreau/B. Marreau

The 1983 Dakar departed from Place de la Concorde in Paris on January 1 and took competitors through France, Algeria, Niger, Upper Volta, Ivory Coast, Mali, Mauritania and finishing in Dakar, Senegal on January 20 for a total of 3,237 miles. There was no scheduled rest day which meant 20 straight days of driving but a violent sandstorm caused the cancellation of several specials forcing 3 rest days!

After previously taking on the Dakar in a Renault 4 in 1979 and a Renault 20 in 1982, the Marreau brothers were again loyal to the French maker. This year they set out in a Renault 18 4x4. For the launch of the R18 4x4 the Marreaus were given two very special R18s. They were equipped with the same engine as the previous year's R20 but with a turbocharger, a full 4WD transmission, long-travel suspension, and general body reinforcements.

In the end, the Marreaus had their worst performance yet finishing in 9th place - due to a shortage of gasoline - with 2 stage wins.
